episodes.title: 17 important minutes of the Pat Broeker talk at the L. Ron Hubbard death briefing
episodes.description:
01:49  The OT 10 worksheet big date
02:00 to 04:00. Pat outlines the 1982 to 1984 summer, the two years of LRH's case folders          would thus be the raw material to compile OT 9 and OT 10.   These years of case folders, like all Hubbard's case folders, have never made it public.   But they are the material the compilers in Senior C/S Int Officer would review to dig up the procedures, and followr LRH's other earlier years of "compilations procedures" orders to turn into pilot processes, etc, and pilot the OT 9 and 10, successful wrap up the piloting and issue the levels to Scientology public.    
05:00  I believe Pat's talking here about what became the End of 
            Life rundown/assist, which Hubbard ordered Ray Mithoff to
            give to Hubbard in Hubbard's final days 14:50 onwards also.
09:20  Pat gives important context to the "tech" and the details of
            what the Comps Branch people, nerds ought read Dan 
            Koon's and others who did this review stuff, how they did the
            sorting of the wheat from the chaff ---  but it was all per 
            Hubbard's orders (I read most if not all of those Hubbard
            orders in the "LRH Compilations Officer Full Hat Checksheet"
            in 1988, there were projects in the LRH Comps Department 
            and even ASI had a project Maria Starkey did the project for
            the LRH "timeless tech" for ASI even.
12:28  An anomaly and violation, Pat says he will "C/S" case- 
            supervise Ray Mithoff's OT 8, this is a violation of Hubbard's 
            technical rules, and later in history Miscavige follows Pat's 
            violation of Hubbard's rules to likewise unauthorizedly case 
           supervise which is a gross violation of the Hubbard rules.  
13:30  OT 9 and OT 10 are supposedly written up, meaning ready 
            for followers to do these steps.  No evidence by others there
            ever saw evidence of this.   Marty Rathbun directly refuted 
            this, and he was firsthand there to witness no evidence of 
            this claim by Pat.   Pat for this point, I hope breaks his 
            silence and coughs up the truth before he croaks on this. 
13:38   Pat claims it is his job to compile several more OT levels 
             on up to OT 13.  Marty Rathbun's book 3 refutes there is 
             sufficient Hubbard "case" folder material with which to 
             compile any more OT levels.   Pat I hope answers this
             contested point before Pat dies.  

******Very Significant*****
13:45 to 14:11   Pat explains the compilations procedure
14:11 to 14:39   Pat describes the raw material from Hubbard to be
                             used to compile the remaining upper OT levels.   
                             Hugely significant section of this Pat Broeker 17 
                             minutes, for nerd experts of how the Hubbard 
                             technical quackery was concocted, and whether 
                            any further quackery can come of what "research" 
                            "case folders" and "notes folder" material can be 
                           used to concoct any further Hubbard "OT levels" 
                           quackery.   Vital info for all time for future 
                           Scientologists.  




Some of what Pat Broeker said in 1986 at this L. Ron Hubbard death event, were based on truth, some has been questioned by others in their books in recent years.  

For Scientologists this 17 minutes of Pat's talk contain much info that is still relevant and ought to still be weighed.

L. Ron Hubbard's "case" folders with Hubbard's final "case" "research" has never seen the light of day.

Very few people have ever seen Hubbard's "case" folders, especially not page by page carefully studying of the whole bulk of Hubbard's own case folders.   Ray Mithoff gave the Hubbard quackery to Hubbard in the end of Hubbard's life, and Ray's worksheets have been seen by even fewer persons.     What all Hubbard told Ray, also, I so wished anyone who has heard of that, or if anyone knows of Ray's taking any notes of what Hubbard told Ray, all that is relevant for true blue Hubbardites or outside expert/nerds/researchers. 

Pat holds up a copy of one edited worksheet, with the zillions of years ago date on it, and Pat explains the context.

There is much important info in this 17 minutes.

It's all quackery to me today, but to nerds of Scientology, there is much to speculate about Pat's 17 minutes.

episodes.title: Pat Broeker, is he giving David Miscavige a face slap here?
episodes.description:
L. Ron Hubbard's small team of people around him at his death, included Pat Broeker.

Pat's importance has been dented by additional info as told in recent ex member books plus in Lawrence Wright's "Going Clear..." book.

Pat Broeker still hasn't gone public all these years, from the time he spoke here in January of 1986.

Important issues about Hubbard's final research, and other points, are worth weighing and reviewing, by anyone nerdy enough to wish to know what was on L. Ron Hubbard's mind near Hubbard's end of life.

The final quackery of Hubbard's is discussed in insider lingo by Pat, but for insider Scientologists this section in this video is still and always will be important to true blue Scientologists to weigh.
